text: ( music playing )

It's the day
before winter break.

Nobody expects you
to learn anything.

All you gotta do
is watch a holiday special
and eat snacks till 3 PM.
But somehow, some way,

on this blow-off day
of all blow-off days,

you get sent
to the principal's office.

It wasn't my fault.
It's like I told Mr. Bonner.

- I don't know how it happened.
- ( alarm ringing )
( all screaming )
Oh, come here. Sit down.
Just stay back.

Just like you didn't know
who was running
that McAllister Elementary

pay-to-play
little league scam.
That was a mystery.

Or who printed up
fake rewards cards
for your grandma.
Okay, for the record,

yogurt prices
are ridiculous these days.

Andy, you are smart
and charming,

and I truly believe
there's nothing you can't do
if you put your mind to it.

But you keep putting your mind
to the wrong stuff.
I swear, Principal Clark,
I'm not a bad kid.
Oh.

Why don't you use this break
as a kind of a reset button?

We can put all of this
in the past,

but I want you to think
about the kind of kid
you wanna be next semester.

Do you wanna be the conniving,
scheming conman,

or do you wanna be
something better?
I wanna be something better.
I can change, Principal Clark.
I know I can.

Please, no boogers
on the blazer.
( sighs )
Tears were a nice touch.
So, you get it?
Dulce, who are you talking to?
I can change, Principal Clark.
I know I can.

Please, no boogers
on the blazer.

The confiscation closet
holds every item ever

unjustly snatched
from a student's hand.

It's the biggest job
we've ever pulled.

And today's our last chance
to pull it.

It's the end of the semester,
which means the school
is gonna empty out the closet

to give all of our stuff
to charity.

We can't let that happen.
How much time do we have?
I'm not a bad kid.
Pick-up's at 2:45.

That gives us five minutes
to pull this off.

- You ready?
- I was born ready.
See you on the other side.

Woman: Say,
"Thank you, Santa Claus."

Santa:
Bye. Merry Christmas.

Well, young lady,
what's your name?

Woman: I'm sorry.
She doesn't speak English.

She's Dutch.
She just came over.
Shouldn't you be in class?
Uh...

She's been living in
an orphans home in Rotterdam
ever since-- we adopted her.

It's the day
before winter break.

Nobody expects you
to learn anything.
All you gotta do is watch a--
( jeering )
This is Principal.

I want you to blow off
the day before 3 PM.
See you next semester.
( cheering )

Uh, hey!
What are you all doing?

- Woohoo!
- Do not make me

call your parents
over this break!
Get back here!

I can't believe
we actually pulled this off.
Clark: Hey!

What are you doing
with that cart?
Nothing.
Andy, we just talked about this.

- And now I catch you with--
- No, Principal Clark, don't!
Both: Cookies?
